content: Hello -- I can't seem to find a stream about how to petition for a new stream here. Any pointers? Do we ask the Admin?
YOu can just create them.
But if you have any questions about whether it's a good idea you can ask here :-)
I did. Now I want to pass the stream's Admin status to another member. How do I do that?
And how do I delete a stream I created? I can't find this in the Zulip documentation (not for when you are a Member and created a stream)?

Are you describing a public stream or a private stream? I think only organization administrators and perhaps moderators have control over public streams once they are created. (I'm not sure of this, just speaking from intuition; would be good to understand the details of the situation.)

Hi Josh --
Here's the situation: I am part of the BR-Core working group (we are developing the FHIR infrastructure for Brazil). I was delegated the task to create a private stream (BR-Core), which I did, but now I find that I can't pass on Admin rights to a member of the HL7 Brasil organization.
My options would be:
1) delete the stream (which I can't seem to find out how to do in Zuilp)
or
2) Somehow the Admin overlords pass administrative rights to Neusa Andrade (of HL7 Brasil).
TIA,
Hank
BTW, who are the Admin overlords here? Who do I get in touch with?
Josh is one. I'm another. However, I don't see a way to delegate admin authority over a single stream. @Josh Mandel?

Yeah, I'm not familiar with any stream ownership model. What specific ability are you looking to "hand over"? In a private stream, any member should be able to invite other members. Are you primary concerned about who is allowed to delete the stream?
OK, then can you please delete the BR-Core stream so we can redo it with the right person in charge?
I apologize for this inconvenience.
The point is "there is no one in charge". Everyone in the closed group can invite others to the closed group. In terms of deletion, that's one of the overall Jira admins.
If there are people you want added to the group, ask one of the existing members to add them.
Got ya. This kinda sucks. I'll see what I can do. Thanks for the help.
What sucks about it? I mean: what are you trying to do that you can't?

Josh Mandel said:

What sucks about it? I mean: what are you trying to do that you can't?

I'm trying to delete the stream. Actually, I went to the Zulip dev forum and a thread there suggested archiving the stream. Problem is, I can neither Archive, Rename or Delete the BR-Core stream.
https://zulip.com/help/archive-a-stream
I do not want to own the stream, it should be a member of the HL7 Brasil.
But they were very busy and we had a cohort of students from a FHIR class so I suggested that maybe I could create the stream. And now I am stuck with perpetual ownership of the thing.
Does that make sense?
Meanwhile, I'm trying to figure out who are the Zulip higher-ups I can go to to ask for the stream's archiving or deletion.
I've emailed webmaster@hl7.org and my fingers are crossed. Such a bothersome little problem I've gotten myself into...
The point is, streams don't have owners. I'll delete it for you though.
Done (technically "archived", but with no historical content these are equivalent).
Thanks (it's not clear we will stick to Zulip, so that's why we needed that).
We couldn't have "BR-Core" sticking around.
